724696f-a.title: Manhattan: West Street - Clarkson Street
724696f-a.text:
West Street, north from Clarkson Street, showing the West Side Elevated
Vehicular Highway under construction. Intersection in the right foreground
is Leroy Street. Pier No. 41 North River (Lackawanna Railroad Co.) which
is at the foot of this street is partially shown on the left. This is a
set of 3 views; No. 2 and 3 being at the northern end of this link (about
Jane Street). The Southern Pacific Steamship Co. ocoupies Pier No. 49.
About 1929.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
724696f-a.folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY

718988f-a.title: Manhattan: Clarkson Street - West Street
718988f-a.text:
Clarkson Street, east from West Street. The northern end of the
new St. John's Park Freight Terminal will be along the south
side of Clarkson Street; and the elevated roadbed will conduct
the traoks along the west side of Washington Street. This accounts
for the demolition of 71 to 6l Clarkson Street, on the north
side, adjoining and at the corner of Washington Street.
September 30, 1930.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718988f-a.folder: Clarkson Street & West Street, Manhattan, NY

West Street, north from Clarkson Street, and showing the new vei-
cular highway. Plainly observable is Pier No. 41 on the left.

Abeut 1929.

724692f-a.title: Manhattan: West Street - Clarkson Street
724692f-a.text:
Vest Street, east side, from Clarkson Street, opposite Pier 40,
North River, to Watts Street (Pier 31). All the old buildings
from Clarkson to Charlton Streets have been cleared away long
since, and construction of the new St. John's Park Freight
Terminal is beginning at the Charlton Street end.
Junc 3, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724692f-a.folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY

West Street, south from Clarkson Street, showing the new vehicular high-

Houston Street; Pier No. 39 North River being at the foot of same.
About 1929.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)

The Southern Pacific Steamship Company occupies Pier No. 49 .

724699f-a.text:

724700f-a.title: Manhattan: West Street - Clarkson Street
724700f-a.text:
Vest street, Clarkson street, looking nobth.(Before reconstruction).
Preaident Borough of Manhaten.
CREDIT LINE ITERATIVE.  June 24, 1918.
724700f-a.folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY

724698f-a.title: Manhattan: West Street - Clarkson Street
724698f-a.text:
350 Weat Street, east side, adioining the south corner of Clarkson
Street, opposite Pier 40, North River. This is a frame house
with stucco facing. It is shortly to be demolished, being a
part of the site of the new St. John's Park Freight Terminal.
On some maps it is shown as No. 349.
June 3, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724698f-a.folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY

724697f-b.title: Manhattan: West Street - Clarkson Street
724697f-b.text:
(1)
Pier 40, North River, West Street, west side, opposite Clarkson
Street.
March 6, 1929.
. P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Northern end of Pier 40, and the railroad flagman's sentry box,
West Street, west side, opposite and north of Clarkson Street.
March 9, 1929.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

724702f-a.folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY

724693f-a.title: Manhattan: West Street - Clarkson Street
724693f-a.text:
west Street, east side, from Clarkson Street, opposite Pier 40,
North Rivcr, to West Houston Street (formerly Harmersly Street),
opposite Pier 39. Den:olition has begun on this entire block,
which is the northermost block included in the futune site of
the new St. John'a Park Freight Terminal. In the right back-
ground a building on the north side of Charlton Street, just
east of West, is being demolished. In the left background
the Standard Statistics Building on Hudson Street (j.v.) may
be seen under construction.
September 30, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724693f-a.folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY
